weather_report:
As morning unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, hints of rain linger lightly in the air, promising just a touch of the unpredictable nature of the coast. The sun fights its way through a veil of gray clouds, aiming to cast its gentle warmth before retreating behind the West Northwest wind, which carries whispers of coolness across the city. The current chill, hovering just above brisk, casts an invigorating spell—there’s a freshness that makes one want to take a long, ambling stroll down the waterfront, perhaps pausing to savor a warm beverage as the temperature softly nudges towards midday. 

By evening, the skies will clear, yielding a serene backdrop for twilight, where the city’s soft lights will begin to twinkle like stars vying for attention. As night approaches, donning layers would be wise; a light jacket or a cozy sweater will serve you well against the cool breeze that will flirt with anyone brave enough to venture outside. Tonight invites a sense of calm—a perfect time for a quiet dinner at a local bistro, or perhaps a leisurely walk through the quiet streets, watching shadows dance in the fading light, embodying the intimacy of this enchanting city.
